title: No children node listing when changing data source for a data set in the Query tab's data set editor page
description: When changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the Query tab, the children node listing is not displayed.
OB: The children node listing is not displayed when changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the Query tab. To reproduce: 1. Create a new data set without an SQL statement. 2. Open the data set editor and go to the data source page. 3. Change the data source to a new one that has no database, table, or column information.
EB: The children node listing should be displayed when changing the data source for a data set in the data set editor page of the Query tab.
SR: To reproduce: 1. Create a new data set without an SQL statement. 2. Open the data set editor and go to the data source page. 3. Change the data source to a new one that has no database, table, or column information. 4. Observe that the children node listing is not displayed. 5. Close the data set editor and reopen it. 6. Observe that the children node listing is still not displayed.
